citeinfo.title: COAL_NCRDS_IN: Coal Resource Data in Indiana, Derived from the National Coal Resource Data System (Indiana Geological Survey, Point Shapefile)
The Indiana Geological Survey Coal Stratigraphic Database, Indiana Geological Survey Open-File Study 01-5

descript.abstract:
This ESRI ArcInfo point shapefile depicts the location of 9,117 public point-source coal resource data points in Indiana. This shapefile includes location and coal resource information for each data point. The coal resource information consists of total coal thickness, depth to the top of the coalbed, and elevation of the top of the coalbed for 26 named coal members of Indiana.
Detailed location and stratigraphic information for each data point are stored in a Microsoft Access database named "NCRDS_Indiana2000.mdb" that is contained in Open-File Study 01-5 of the Indiana Geological Survey. COAL_NCRDS_IN is a GIS representation of the data contained within NCRDS_Indiana2000.mdb.
descript.purpose:
The purpose of this ESRI ArcInfo point shapefile is to provide a visual representation and a summary of the data contained within the database NCRDS_Indiana2000.mdb: The Indiana Geological Survey National Coal Resources Data System database, a Microsoft Access database of public, point-source coal resource data in Indiana.
Since 1980, staff members of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) have collected and entered coal resource information into the NCRDS_Indiana2000.mdb database as a cooperative project with the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS). The purpose of this project is to provide a means of rapid retrieval of point-source coal resource information, including coal location, thickness, depth, and other parameters.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcView version 3.3 point shapefile Microsoft Windows NT version 4.0

attracc.attraccr:
Data points were checked to determine whether or not all data points are located within the areal extent of the Pennsylvanian System boundary, as depicted in a 1:500,000 scale ESRI ArcInfo polygon coverage of Indiana bedrock information. Since this database is limited to data points of coal resource information, one should expect all data points to lie within the coal-bearing Pennsylvanian System boundary. This test was performed by displaying this point coverage on the bedrock polygon coverage using ESRI ArcView software. The result of this check revealed that all but a small fraction of the data points were located within the areal extent of the Pennsylvanian System boundary. Those few data points that were outside of the Pennsylvanian System boundary were within one mile of the boundary and are assumed to be valid data.
Spot checks were conducted to compare the values that appear in the fields named "Twnship" and "Range" with townships and ranges in the Public Land Survey System (PLSS) of Indiana. Several discrepancies were noted but not corrected.
Coal beds in Indiana seldom exceed 15 feet in thickness. However, inspection of thickness values indicates that some records exceed reasonable limits for coal thickness.

dataqual.complete: This point shapefile contains 9,117 data points. The coals that are described in this point shapefile are limited to 26 named coal members of Indiana. Unnamed coals in Indiana are not included in this compilation.

horizpa.horizpar: The accuracy of the location information contained in this ESRI ArcInfo point shapefile is dependent upon the accuracy of the source data of each data point, and the accuracy with which these data were manually entered into the database. Based upon the source data, the location accuracy ranges from recorded x,y coordinates based upon surveyed locations to x,y coordinates obtained by plotting the data point on a 1:24,000-scale 7.5-minute quadrangle topographic map based upon township, range, section and quarter information, and then digitizing the data point to obtain x,y coordinate information.

vertacc.vertaccr: The accuracy of the location information contained in this ESRI ArcInfo point shapefile is dependent upon the accuracy of the source data of each data point, and the accuracy with which these data were manually entered into the database. Based upon the source data, the vertical positional accuracy ranges from ground surface elevation information based upon surveyed locations to elevations obtained by plotting the data point on a 1:24,000-scale 7.5-minute quadrangle topographic map based upon township, range, section and quarter information, and then recording the elevation value from the topographic map.

citeinfo.title: NCRDS_Indiana2000.mdb: The Indiana Geological Survey National Coal Resources Data System database, a Microsoft Access database of public, point-source coal resource data in Indiana.

srctime.srccurr: Date of most recent update to the database

srcinfo.srccontr: The source contributed location and attribute information for 11,560 public point-source coal resource data points in Indiana.

procstep.procdesc: A Microsoft Access database named "NCRDS_Indiana2000.mdb" was obtained from Open-File Study 01-5 of the Indiana Geological Survey. All the work was done with a table named “STRATIGRAPHY.” Two intermediate crosstab queries, “STRATIGRAPHY_CROSSTAB” and “STRATIGRAPHY_CROSSTAB1” were created. The first query used the table fields named “pointid,” “bed,” and “FROMDEPTH,” while the second used the fields named “pointid,” “bed,” and “thk.” The next step was to create a result query by using the intermediate queries joined with “pointid.” The result query was called “RESULT.” Finally, the dbf and txt files were generated by exporting the query “Result” to dbf and txt format, named "TESTRESU.DBF" and "TESTRESULT.TXT," respectively.

The file named "TESTRESU.DBF" was opened in Microsoft Excel. The database was sorted to identify all records for which no data existed for any coal bed. The records that did not contain any values for depth, elevation, or thickness for any coal bed (2,443 in total) were deleted. The database was then saved as "TESTRESU_9999.DBF."

The file named "TESTRESU_9999.DBF" was added as a table to a View in ESRI ArcView. The "Add Event Theme" function was then used to import the data, using fields named "UTMX83" and UTMY83" in TESTRESU_9999.DBF for x- and y-coordinates. The "Convert to Shapefile" function was used to create a shapefile named "COAL_NCRDS_IN."

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Data point identification value
Name of the person who supervised the entry of a given data point into the database

attrdomv.udom: Valid values for this field are the surnames, or first name initial and surname of Indiana Geological Survey staff members preceded by "INGS-"

attr.attrdef: Description of the source from which the data are derived
attr.attrdefs: User-assigned based upon information obtained from the source data

attr.attrdef: Elevation of the ground surface relative to mean sea level in decimal feet
attr.attrdefs: Source data set of the data point or user assigned based upon data point location

attr.attrdef: Numeric code to be used (if necessary) to qualify the ground surface elevation values (surfelv)
attr.attrdefs: User-assigned based upon the elevation accuracy of the source data

edom.edomvd: etm +/- 10 ft (etm = estimated from topographic map)
etm +/- 20 ft (etm = estimated from topographic map)

attr.attrdef: The total thickness in decimal feet of the section, core, log, etc. that is being described
Numeric code used to describe the type of data point
The fourth (and smallest) of four quarters in a section within a given Township and Range of the Public Land Survey System
attr.attrdefs: User assigned based upon data point location

attr.attrdef: The third (and second smallest) of four quarters in a section within a given township and range of the Public Land Survey System
attr.attrdefs: User-assigned based upon data point location

attr.attrdef: The second (and second largest) of four quarters in a section within a given township and range of the Public Land Survey System
attr.attrdefs: User-assigned based upon data point location

attr.attrdef: The first (and largest) of four quarters in a section within a given township and range of the Public Land Survey System
attr.attrdefs: User-assigned based upon data point location

attr.attrdef: Number of the section within a given township and range of the Public Land Survey System
attr.attrdefs: User-assigned based upon data point location

attr.attrdef: Township value
attr.attrdefs: User-assigned based upon data point location

attr.attrdef: One-letter code used to indicate whether the township north or township south
attr.attrdefs: User-assigned based upon data point location

attrdomv.udom: Valid values are: N or S

attr.attrdef: Range value
attr.attrdefs: User-assigned based upon data point location

attr.attrdef: One-letter code used to indicate range east or range west
attr.attrdefs: User-assigned based upon data point location

attrdomv.udom: Valid values are: E or W

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Geological Survey be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: COAL_NCRDS_IN: Coal Resource Data in Indiana, Derived from the National Coal Resource Data System (Indiana Geological Survey, Point Shapefile)
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
